title: To all the support mains saying they can't get an S

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
I decided to "experiment" in ranked which a lot would flame and hate me for but I decided to yolo anyway and picked support despite me never playing the role much ever. I picked soraka and I had 0 idea what to build so I just went spirit visage and ardent censer because they seemed to make sense with soraka's kit. Surprise we won the game AND I got an S-. Maybe I got lucky or maybe it's not actually hard to get an S playing support. Just think to yourself "if a random guy who never plays support and has 0 idea what to build can get an S then I can too".

To all the struggling support mains out there, keep going!

because thats not played often and galio opp

And you have the things that actually count for supports to get s's, lowish deaths (remember sorakas have a higher death count because focusing soraka is a thing) and a few kill steals.

Not to mention, if that is an S-, it shows how much proper support statistics aren't counted.

Low wards, Low ward destruction, Low damage taken, Average healing.

I feel everyone weights ward control as a important factor for a support; and whilst I love playing the vision control game; from trying to get hextech and champion mastery levels; your kda and how high your cs is generally ends up mattering more as a support. I don't even understand why cs is important but you try to get as much as you can when your adc is backed or during midlate game.

It's easy to get S or S+ when playing non supports but its seriously the easiest thing to do as the system goes by the champion then looks at the role you played that game so if i played galio within the next few games i would be judged say by your game not by every support game played with different champion. Hope that made it clear to some people that don't know the system yet.

Saying that popular supports like Thresh, Leona, Sona, Braum etc. yes its a high chance you're going to get an s when you let your team carry you and you throw just an ult in a team fight and say all you but you are not doing the full support role and cause sooooo many people play these champions is hard to be getting S  and S+'s 

I've gotten plenty of S's on supports I'm not complaining, well lately I've been trying with leona to get my level 7 but dam all leona is to throw her stuff out and you basically die to get your adc fed which decreases your score not increase it cause you died many times, close I've gotten is S- since the rework lol.
